D7:
$internal_link = l(t('Book admin'), 'admin/structure/book');

D8:

use Drupal\Core\Link;
use Drupal\Core\Url;
$url = Url::fromRoute('book.admin');
$internal_link = Link::fromTextAndUrl(t('Book admin'), $url)->toString();

:rolling_eyes:

Url::fromRoute('book.admin')
What the heck is a 'route'!? And why can't I just link to a URL?
:expressionless: :gun:
The concept of a route is pretty common with other libraries such as Node and Laravel. Though I can see how it can be confusing

Yes, routes are confusing, but my main pain point with D8 is the complexity added (IMO, unnecessarily). What was one line of code in D7 becomes 4 lines in D8. Another example is the deprecation of arg(): https://www.drupal.org/node/2274705 (read the first few comments on that page)
As one commenter alluded to, D8 is going in the opposite direction to other software, specifically jQuery with its "Write less, do more" motto.
(Drupal seems to have adopted a "Write more, do the same" motto :laughing: )
I recall a Drupalcon presentation making a similar point. By someone who worked heavily on menu system in Drupal 7 and 8. Can't recall who exactly
I seem to recall that those routes also required some YAML code. Am I not remembering that correctly? I stopped doing anything with D8 about 3 years ago.
@oadaeh (Jason Flatt) Yes, I think if you create your own menu items you need YAML code to do so.
I think it's for creating a route, not referencing one. The yaml makes that step easier
